perturbation.original_text: The undersigned hereby agree that the Schedule 13G/A with respect to the shares of Class A Common Stock, $0.001 par value per share, of The RMR Group Inc., dated as of December 31, 2019, is, and any amendments thereto (including amendments on Schedule 13D) signed by each of the undersigned shall be, filed on behalf of each of us pursuant to and in accordance with the provisions of Rule 13d-1(k) under the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended.
perturbation.changed_text: The undersigned hereby agree that the Schedule 13G/A with respect to the shares of Class A Common Stock, $0.001 par value per share, of The RMR Group Inc., dated as of December 31, 2019, is, and any amendments thereto signed by any of the undersigned may be, filed on behalf of the filing party at their discretion, notwithstanding the provisions of Rule 13d-1(k) under the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended.
perturbation.explanation: By changing 'shall be' to 'may be' and adding that filings are at the discretion of the party, the agreement now contradicts the mandatory filing requirements under Rule 13d-1(k) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934. This introduces uncertainty as to whether all parties are obligated to jointly file, which is required under the rule for certain ownership thresholds and agreements.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Rule 13d-1(k) under the Securities Exchange Act of 1934

perturbation.original_text: January 22, 2020 (Date) ABP TRUST /s/ Adam D. Portnoy (Signature) Adam D. Portnoy, President (Name/Title) ADAM D. PORTNOY /s/ Adam D. Portnoy (Signature)
perturbation.changed_text: January 22, 2020 (Date) ABP TRUST Adam D. Portnoy, President (Name/Title) ADAM D. PORTNOY
perturbation.explanation: Removing the signatures introduces uncertainty because valid contracts require authorized signatures. This could lead to a dispute over the validity of the agreement under contract law, as it's unclear if the parties truly consented.
perturbation.contradicted_law: General contract law principles regarding required signatures for enforceable agreements.
